title: Bloodstone Taric is too Pink
body:
Granted it is not as pink as Armor of the Fifth Age, but it is far from a blood red. This is quick edit with color slider. I make no claim on quality, just illustarting the point:
http://oi68.tinypic.com/2hydiye.jpg
http://oi68.tinypic.com/nc1jpg.jpg
Here the original to compare:
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IwZrenZLrVs/VwQDDnfuRxI/AAAAAAAA5es/eKgmtZ25hpcV64NVVUXjKVV6oXewxgCKA/s640/Taric_Splash_3.jpg
https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-03Qlci8c6aQ/VwQi7zafWpI/AAAAAAAANEY/WrRuU21ktzsVyazN1g48MWtWiK_UFy8pA/s640/taric3turn.jpg

Also the change in skin tone to something a bit healthier than "creepy vampire purple grey" also makes him more appelaing an charismatic as is fitting for Taric. Improve a bit on that claw of a hand and you really have a great taric skin that can compete with the other three. (not saying that my edits are that much of an improvement, but I think if the original artist made these changes it would make it perfect)

Edit. Thanks for the upvotes guys, keep the snowball rolling! We need to let Riot know about this, we have done it before, so let's do it again!

I much prefer the CURRENT version of the skin as well as the in-game model.

I definitely do not agree with your edited version.

Why I prefer the original to your version:

1. Your version is too red. The warmth is far too much. This gives off the wrong vibe. The theme becomes more of Fire than that of blood. Taric ends up looking sweaty. Look at Bloodstone Lyssandra and again we can see the artist used a fair amount of pinks/purples in the colors. This is because its not "Firestone" but instead "boodlstone". 

2. Its too simple. The edited version is like saying "oh well blood is red so lets drop some red paint on it and call it a day". It ignores a sense of color depth. Its like saying Nocturnes splash is not black enough because he has shades of blue and other colors.

3. The original used better contrast. The best "dark" imagery in art have a great sense of contrast but only when its done right. The saying is true "the brighter the light, the deeper the shadow" and i think thats what the artist was going for. 

4.  The original conveys exactly the artists own interpretation. You can look at any piece of art and say "oh.. i think it should be blah blah blah" all you want. Sometimes it might come off better to the audience as a whole but it still comes down to personal taste. In this case, I think any changes to it just makes it look tacky. The artist went with a vampire-like theme due to the .. vampire-like theme, "Bloodstone".

Basically I almost always gravitate towards the artists original look XD

Now I´ma be honest here. I like BOTH versions. 
But I still can´t understand some of your complains. Heres why:

> Your version is too red. The **warmth** is far too much. This gives off the wrong vibe. The theme becomes more of **Fire **than that of blood. Taric ends up looking sweaty. Look at Bloodstone Lyssandra and again we can see the artist used a fair amount of pinks/purples in the colors. This is because its not "Firestone" but instead "boodlstone".

The new Tarics "stones" are not "stones" anymore. It´s condensed starlight.
Get where I´m going with that? Stars = Suns = Fire = Warmth.
So it´s techincally not wrong to make him HOT in as many ways as possible.

> Its too simple. The edited version is like saying "oh well blood is red so lets drop some red paint on it and call it a day". It ignores a sense of color depth. Its like saying Nocturnes splash is not black enough because he has shades of blue and other colors.

It´s not simple to let him shine in the colors of a dying supernova (no clue if that´s what it looks like, but I´m SURE there are SOME stars in SOME states that look cool/dark/red^^).

> Not so much contrast. The best "dark" imagery in art have a great sense of contrast but only when its done right. The saying is true "the brighter the light, the deeper the shadow" and i think thats what the artist was going for. 

The original Bloodstone skin was super dark. Then that good "recolored" and went on from being black/dark to purple/in purple.
But well, that´s just personal preference.


Just my 2 cents.
